title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 December 2011 - XWiki
content:
10:07 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <vmassol> XWIKI-7227  
10:07 <+tmortagne> http://pastebin.com/jjV9fafz  
10:07 <+tmortagne> that's looks pretty bad  
10:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> stopping the link checker  
10:50 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: why 2 "Update extension last version"?  
11:28 <jvelo> has quit  
11:28 <vmassol> seems it's the same actuzlly  
11:28 <vmassol> rev2=10.1  
11:28 <vmassol> we have 2 notifications though  
11:28 <vmassol> hmm  
11:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: I see this in the id for the faq application: "${defaultIdPrefix}faq-application"  
11:29 <vmassol> do you know who's set this? is it automatic?  
11:29 <vmassol> what's the value of "$defaultIdPrefix"?  
11:30 <vmassol> do we have a rule for the ids we should use on extensions.xwiki.org?  
11:30 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's a configuration but having ${defaultIdPrefix} is a bugn is it a new page ?  
11:30 <vmassol> it's not a new page  
11:30 <+tmortagne> so probably been created when there was a bug in the sheet  
11:31 <+tmortagne> you can find the condiguration in the admin UI  
11:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: so right now the id is set empty when creating a new extension, right?  
11:33 <+tmortagne> no  
11:33 <vmassol> ah  
11:33 <vmassol> so what's the default id?  
11:34 <+tmortagne> that's weird, I did set one, maybe it has been reseted  
11:36 <vmassol> ok so the default id is: prefix + page name with spaces replaced by dash ("-") ?  
11:36 <vmassol> (all in lowercase)  
11:36 <+tmortagne> prefix + cleaned name yes (don't remember exactly the applied filter)  
11:37 <vmassol> what are the consequences of changing an id? does it mean that locally installed extensions won't be recoegnized as installed if the id has changed on the server and you install the "new" extension?  
11:37 <vmassol> (ie they'll be considered as 2 different extensions)  
11:38 <+tmortagne> it's the same as changing the id of a maven artifact  
11:38 <+tmortagne> that's what EM use to know it's the same extensions with just a different version  
11:38 <vmassol> ok so we should be careful not to change it  
11:38 <+tmortagne> so if it's not the same extension then no upgrade etc...  
11:39 <vmassol> even if the page name ahs changed  
11:39 <vmassol> so changing the prefix in the preferences is really really dangerous  
11:39 <+tmortagne> yes it's not supposed to be changed it just use the page name the first time becuase it has to use something  
11:39 <vmassol> hmm I wonder if we should even allow it to be changed  
11:39 <+tmortagne> but the best is to explicitely provide it  
11:40 <vmassol> do we need it in the admin at all?  
11:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: how to you set it without admin ?  
11:40 <vmassol> why do you need to set it?  
11:40 <+tmortagne> because it's XR  
11:40 <vmassol> I don't understand  
11:41 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rf90e02c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java : XWIKI-7224: XWikiPreferences in view mode does no not redirect to admin mode - http://git.io/GaBOvw  
11:41 <+tmortagne> it's not just extensions.xwiki.org  
11:41 <+tmortagne> sevral difference repository will not have the same prefix  
11:41 <vmassol> where is this prefix used?  
11:41 <+tmortagne> to not have collisions  
11:42 <+tmortagne> EM get extensions comming form several repositories and they need to have different ids if it's no the same extensions, the repository prefix is a protection for people who never set explicitely the id  
11:42 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.2.x \* r4900027 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java : XWIKI-7224: XWikiPreferences in view mode does no not redirect to admin mode ...  
11:42 <+tmortagne> but as I said the best is to properly choose your id  
11:43 <vmassol> its so important that we shouldn't let people choose it IMO  
11:43 <+tmortagne> also you can change the prefix id if you want  
11:43 <+tmortagne> it's not going to break anything  
11:43 <vmassol> why not hardcode it to extensions.xwiki.org: when creating a new extension  
11:43 <vmassol> ?  
11:43 <+tmortagne> it's used to generate an id when you create en extension  
11:44 <+tmortagne> vmassol: because again it's XR  
11:44 <vmassol> so ${defaultIdPrefix} is no longer used?  
11:44 <+tmortagne> it's not going to help much having it on git...  
11:44 <+tmortagne> it is  
11:44 <+tmortagne> again it's used when you create en extension  
11:44 <+tmortagne> that's the variable comming from the configuration  
11:44 <vmassol> after you created the extension  
11:45 <vmassol> what value does the id field has?  
11:45 <vmassol> org.xwiki.extensions:...  
11:45 <vmassol> or  
11:45 <vmassol> ${defaultIdPrefix}....  
11:45 <vmassol> ?  
11:46 <+tmortagne> again it's not a dynamic id its generated when the extensions is age is created, as I said you just found an extension which has been created when there was a bug in the sheet that made it priint ${defaultIdPrefix} instead of its value  
11:47 <vmassol> ok if the value is used now then good  
11:47 <vmassol> I didn't see it but that's probably because it wasn't set on extensions.xwiki.org  
11:47 <vmassol> it might still be good to have some validation on this  
11:47 <vmassol> when validating an extension  
11:48 <vmassol> some custom validation for extensions.xwiki.org for ex  
11:48 <+tmortagne> there is a integration test on this  
11:48 <+tmortagne> it's actually the first thing that has been tested  
11:48 <vmassol> well it's not working  
11:48 <vmassol> :)  
11:48 <vmassol> since on extensions.xwiki.org  
11:48 <+tmortagne> what do you want to validate ?  
11:48 <vmassol> we have valid extensions that don't have the prefix  
11:48 <+tmortagne> they are valid  
11:48 <vmassol> verify that on extensions.xwiki.org there's not extension  
11:49 <vmassol> that doesn't have the "org.xwiki.extensions:" prefix  
11:49 <+tmortagne> the prefix is just for people not setting explicit id  
11:49 <vmassol> well I don't think we want to allow people to choose their id completely  
11:49 <vmassol> that's going to be a mess  
11:49 <+tmortagne> it's just here to be a default id prefix and nothing elese  
11:49 <vmassol> at least the prefix should be set  
11:49 <+tmortagne> if you import an extension comming from a maven repository it's going to keep the same id  
11:50 <+tmortagne> otherwise yo ubreak it  
11:50 <vmassol> hmm  
11:50 <+tmortagne> no  
11:50 <+tmortagne> it should not\*  
11:50 <vmassol> if someone sets a full extension id of "panel" we need to know  
11:51 <vmassol> because it's not a good id  
11:51 <+tmortagne> sure it's not good id  
11:51 <+tmortagne> but that's another subject  
11:51 <vmassol> that's the subject I 'm discussing :)  
11:51 <vmassol> ie how to have good ids and define a naming rule  
11:51 <vmassol> since we're going to start using the EM real soon now  
11:52 <vmassol> and chagning ids is very important  
11:52 <vmassol> s/very important/a major change/  
11:52 <vmassol> basically ids are like APIs  
11:52 <vmassol> as important as APIs  
11:54 <+tmortagne> naming rule is one thing, having a technically validation for them is not that easy, it's not just about some regexp  
11:56 <vmassol> for example  
11:56 <vmassol> the panel macro is currnetl set as:  
11:56 <vmassol> "panel-macro"  
11:56 <vmassol> in a few days/weeks the panel macro will be released in the xwiki maven repo  
11:56 <vmassol> with a groupid of "org.xwiki.contrib"  
11:56 <vmassol> what will we do?  
11:56 <vmassol> is there a notion of "id alias"? :)  
11:57 <+tmortagne> put the proper id  
11:57 <vmassol> (or "deprecated ids")  
11:57 <vmassol> it means people who have it already installed will see it as available for installation  
11:57 <+tmortagne> it's not like the current id has been really chosen  
11:57 <vmassol> that's not hte issue  
11:57 <vmassol> the issue is for users  
11:57 <vmassol> they don't care about the id  
11:58 <vmassol> they don't even know about it  
11:58 <vmassol> they see it's available and they install the "panel macro"  
11:59 <+tmortagne> yes and if you don't touch the id there is not going to be any issue with that  
11:59 <vmassol> we probably need some "alias" feature to allow id renaming  
11:59 <vmassol> but you said the opposite  
11:59 <vmassol> "put the proper id"  
11:59 <+tmortagne> put the proper id from the start  
11:59 <vmassol> ahah  
11:59 <vmassol> that's funny  
11:59 <vmassol> it's like saying: write code without bugs  
11:59 <+tmortagne> it should have never been an id like that  
12:00 <vmassol> the proof  
12:00 <vmassol> is that the panel macro can already be installed  
12:00 <vmassol> with the id "panel-macro"  
12:00 <vmassol> ;)  
12:00 <vmassol> for ex the Plover app provided by jerome  
12:01 <vmassol> it has a strange name and I think jerome might have made a mistake and he might want to rename it in the future  
12:01 <vmassol> do we keep the same id  
12:01 <vmassol> or should we allow to rename it  
12:01 <+tmortagne> sure we have a beta in progress repository from which you can install stuff not fully validated as ready to be installed  
12:03 <vmassol> btw we haven't compeltely decided yet on page names for extensions either  
12:03 <vmassol> more speicficallt do we suffix with "Applicatoin", "Macro", etc  
12:03 <vmassol> (do we force it)  
12:03 <vmassol> or not  
12:04 <vmassol> since that's going to be used as the default id, it means that as soon as the page is saved the extension is available for use from XE installs  
12:06 <vmassol> maybe we need a manual validation step  
12:06 <vmassol> same as what apple does with the app store ;)  
12:11 <CIA-115> tmortagne master \* r71e400b / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7228: Support URL without explicit prefix in XR download link - http://git.io/SfGekQ  
12:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi just got a bug trying to install the FAQ app: http://pastebin.com/dCW7NPqu  
12:12 <vmassol> Caused by: class java.io.IOException: Invalid answer (201) fo the server when requesting  
12:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think I just got the same in the test i'm currently writing actually, the download link is an URL ?  
12:20 <vmassol> yes  
12:20 <vmassol> but I've prefixed it with: "url:"  
12:20 <+tmortagne> yep but that's not the issue  
12:20 <vmassol> ok  
12:20 <+tmortagne> i'm on it  
12:22 <+Denis> tmortagne, vmassol: There is several places in the component code where we compare classnames in place of classes with a comment about classloaders, but I do not understand your UC, since we have strong typing, we should always get a cast exception, no?  
12:23 <+tmortagne> hmm, Denis indeed you are probably right  
12:23 <+tmortagne> since we actually never had the use case in real...  
12:24 <+tmortagne> so comparing class name is probably totally useless anyway  
12:24 <+tmortagne> well that's cool, will make the CM even quicker ;)  
12:25 <+Denis> probably, you should put that in your recent improvement  
12:25 <+tmortagne> yep  
12:26 <vmassol> actually findbugs will even report a style violation: http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/bugDescriptions.html#EQ\_COMPARING\_CLASS\_NAMES  
12:31 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know why http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/ have been failing for so long?  
12:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: because it's based on the old UI  
12:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: ah you mean sdumitriu didn't update them when he chanegd the UI?  
12:42 <+tmortagne> yes  
12:42 <vmassol> :(  
12:42 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I added a comment to XWIKI-7227  
12:45 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok will look at it after lunch  
12:54 <mflorea> has quit  
13:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know why this is of type "other" and not "plugin": http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Wiki+Manager+Plugin ?  
13:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw it seems the LT filtering for "plugin" is broken: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&type=plugin  
13:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: changed its type when I made it working without the need to setup xwiki.cfg plugins variable to basically not getting plugin related installation instructions anymore  
13:54 <vmassol> so it should be a components no?  
13:54 <vmassol> (for the type)  
13:55 <+tmortagne> now probably yes even if it's not a very clean component, this type was not really existing when I made the change  
13:55 <+tmortagne> it's also still a plugin, you still use as a plugin so it's a bit in between  
13:55 <+tmortagne> s/still/still can/  
13:56 <vmassol> sure but if it works as a component we don't need to advertise is as a plugin anymore  
13:56 <+tmortagne> but it will be more usefull wit the type jar  
13:56 <vmassol> since a plugin is "less good"  
13:56 <vmassol> so the extension name could be changed too  
13:56 <vmassol> (even though the impl is not nice but that just requires a refactoringà  
13:56 <vmassol> (internal impl)  
13:57 <+tmortagne> yep but it mean breaking links  
13:57 <vmassol> 2 options  
13:57 <vmassol> - either we don't care, as we've done for a lot of such links in the past (we just fix our xwiki.org links)  
13:57 <vmassol> - or we do as jerome has done for plover and as we have for some extensions, ie do a redirect  
13:58 <vmassol> - or we implement what jerome is doing on winesqure, which is to have an Alias class and modify the template to look up aliases ;)  
13:58 <vmassol> or we keep the plugin  
13:58 <vmassol> both I mean  
13:59 <vmassol> since up to a certain version it was a plugin  
13:59 <+tmortagne> yes  
13:59 <+tmortagne> that too  
13:59 <vmassol> and then starting at a given version it became a component  
14:00 <+tmortagne> but "plugin" type does not mean anything technically so it's not a big deal, it's not going to break anything  
14:01 <vmassol> can you reproduce the issue when filtering the LT on "plugins"?  
14:02 <+tmortagne> yes  
14:03 <+tmortagne> maybe it's because xwiki.org war is too recent for the current xar and produce a bug in th eLT  
14:03 <vmassol> since all other types work well I'm surpsied  
14:03 <+tmortagne> even if there is nothing special about plugin type AAIK  
14:03 <vmassol> do we have custom LT handling for "plugins"?  
14:03 <+tmortagne> no idea what it means  
14:04 <+tmortagne> it's just a string field  
14:04 <+tmortagne> in the DB  
14:04 <+tmortagne> maybe there is an issue with DBLIst  
14:05 <+tmortagne> now as far as I can see in the log xwiki.org database is not is a really good state, there is lots of incoherency  
14:06 <vmassol> ah I have an idea  
14:07 <vmassol> let me check the validity of the returned json  
14:07 <vmassol> yep that's it  
14:07 <vmassol> Parse error on line 551:  
14:07 <vmassol> ...   "authors\_value": "[Ludovic Dubost| J  
14:07 <vmassol> -----------------------^  
14:07 <vmassol> Expecting 'STRING', 'NUMBER', 'NULL', 'TRUE', 'FALSE', '{', '['  
14:07 <vmassol> fixing  
14:08 <+tmortagne> well that looks like a bug, the JSON should always be valid whatever the datas  
14:08 <vmassol> yes  
14:09 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue  
14:10 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-1057  
14:15 <vmassol> fixed on xwiki.org  
14:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <lucaa> has quit  
15:17 <DrLou> has quit  
15:29 <fmancinelli> has quit  
15:36 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r968efab / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/WebHome.xml : XWIKI-7190: Create the AppWithinMinutes wizard ...  
15:57 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r9f2ee0b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/LiveTableGenerator.xml : XWIKI-7190: Create the AppWithinMinutes wizard ...  
16:04 <JuanDaugherty> i gather there's no XWiki approved/packaged approach to running Xwiki such as the XEM as a Windows Service  
16:05 <JuanDaugherty> as opposed to chatter from users  
16:05 <JuanDaugherty> \*from/with  
16:05 <JuanDaugherty> \*chatter with/support of  
16:07 <JuanDaugherty> i.e. I assume http://qns.net/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Windows+Service+for+Jetty+7 is not assoc with XWiki just a user running current  
16:10 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: you can run xwiki as a service  
16:11 <vmassol> it's actually not related to xwiki but to the servlet container you use  
16:11 <vmassol> and they can all be executed as a windows service  
16:12 <JuanDaugherty> no doubt, but unclear ATM how that relates to the standard command line initiation shells, looking for it in the docs  
16:16 <vmassol> guys, any ETA for starting the RC1 release?  
16:18 <JuanDaugherty> is that 3.3?  
16:18 <vmassol> yes  
16:26 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I'm trying to use the localization module in a recent 3.3 snapshot and in 3.2 but $l10n is not present in the velocity context. The documentation says that this module is bundled with XE, and there are no installation notes so it should work without any config. Do you know why it doesn't? I see that the localization module is using a VelocityContextInitializer, but it's not the only module using this old way.  
16:26 <+mflorea> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization+Module  
16:30 <vmassol> this module is not bundled anymore AFAIK  
16:30 <vmassol> and it's not ready to be used  
16:31 <vmassol> (it may work or may not, I have no clue but we're not building it AFAIK - let me check)  
16:31 <vmassol> yep we don't build it  
16:31 <vmassol> it may not even build for all I know  
16:31 <vmassol> sergiu started it but never finished it  
16:31 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
16:32 <vmassol> we've been waiting for sergiu to revive it  
16:32 <vmassol> our newest plan is for thomas or me to work on it in not long  
16:33 <+mflorea> "Bundled With" should be removed also  
16:34 <vmassol> indeed  
16:43 <+mflorea> vmassol: translation prefix for an XWiki app must follow this pattern xe.appName.\* right? That is xe.appWithinMinutes.\* for AppWithinMinutes. It's a bit odd we're using xe.\* because blog, administration, invitation, etc. are in the platform.  
16:43 <CIA-115> tmortagne master \* rb29afb8 / (2 files): XWIKI-7228: Fail to download extension file from XR when provided as URL - http://git.io/3DaJWg  
16:45 <vmassol> mflorea: the correct naming AFAIK is:  
16:45 <vmassol> <top level project>.<modulename>.<key>=<value>  
16:45 <vmassol> so for app with minutes that will be:  
16:46 <vmassol> platform.appWithinMinutes.<key>=<value>  
16:47 <+mflorea> this makes more sense, but by looking at the keys form ApplicationResources.properties this pattern is not followed by apps that I mentioned, like blog, invitation, administration, office importer  
16:47 <vmassol> the latest I've added for ex are:  
16:47 <vmassol> # Link Checker Application Resources  
16:47 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.indexTab=External Links  
16:47 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.livetable.link=Link  
16:47 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.livetable.page=Page  
16:47 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.livetable.code=State  
16:47 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.livetable.date=Last Checked  
16:48 <vmassol> yes it's not  
16:48 <vmassol> we have like 20 different rules in application resources right now :(  
16:49 <+mflorea> yes :(  
16:49 <vmassol> actually  
16:49 <+mflorea> dashboard is also following the rule  
16:49 <vmassol> yes because  
16:49 <vmassol> I've updated them during 3.3M2  
16:49 <vmassol> ....  
16:49 <vmassol> re linkchecker keys actually I'm not sure I'm following fully the rule  
16:49 <vmassol> for example:  
16:49 <vmassol> platform.linkchecker.livetable.code or platform.linkchecker.livetableCode  
16:50 <CIA-115> tmortagne master \* r713616f / (2 files in 2 dirs): More tests: ...  
16:50 <vmassol> I think I had proposed  platform.linkchecker.livetableCode actually....  
16:50 <vmassol> we need to put those rules somehwere in stone on xwiki.org  
16:50 <+mflorea> I prefer the first in this case, because there are multiple keys for livetable  
16:50 <vmassol> and?  
16:51 <vmassol> both would work with several keys  
16:51 <+mflorea> I see "livetable" as a submodule  
16:51 <vmassol> that doesn't exist  
16:51 <vmassol> there's no notion of submodule  
16:51 <vmassol> that's why I don't like it  
16:51 <+mflorea> ok  
16:52 <vmassol> honestly I don't recall our vote on this  
16:52 <vmassol> I don't even remember if we voted or of it was just a proposal  
16:52 <+mflorea> so you're saying that we should have only 3 levels: platform.moduleName.suffix, where suffix doesn't use .  
16:52 <vmassol> suffix is <key name> without "." yes  
16:53 <vmassol> I think that's what I proposedsome time ago  
16:53 <vmassol> we'd need to find the emails again to be sure  
16:53 <vmassol> ok found it  
16:53 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/tnrfvkavbdeuw4zl  
16:54 <vmassol> only thomas answered… :(  
16:56 <+mflorea> indeed..  
16:56 <vmassol> let me resend as a vote  
16:56 <vmassol> doing it now  
16:57 <+mflorea> ok  
17:00 <vmassol> done  
17:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: I guess you need to update xwiki.org to get URL working for extensions?  
17:36 <vmassol> are you going to restart it?
